name: Tracker Tests
shortDesc: A page of various trackers used in a study related to Ghostery
content: This is a simple HTML page containing links to other HTML pages that each use one service or site blocked by Ghostery.
Technologies: JavaScript, HTML

name: Brave Frontier Frame Animator
shortDesc: Java Program to create GIFs of unit sprites from the mobile game Brave Frontier
content: Using the bookClasses as a base and a GIF processing library, I developed a program to read some CSV and PNG files and output GIFs and strips of frames that can be put into GIF form.
Technologies: Java, Eclipse IDE (current development)

name: File Indexer
shortDesc: A small program to read a directory and output a list of them to a CSV file.
content: Program to read a chosen directory and output the names of the files within it (along with their respective times of creation, last access, and last modified) to a CSV file in the directory.
Technologies: Java, Eclipse IDE (current development)

name: Brave Frontier Database Reader (Web Version)
shortDesc: Web page to read data from a specific set of JSON files (i.e. a datamine of JSON files).
content: Developed a website that uses a set of JSON files as a database and parses and displays the information in a more readable format. The site also gives the user the text needed to save the data into HTML or Markdown format.
This web page, as of March 2017, could be considered the precursor to BFDBReader-node.
Technologies: HTML, Bootstrap, JavaScript, CSS, JSON
footer: Link to web page | Link to GitHub Repository

name: MMSS Server
shortDesc: Server-side component for the Multi Module Security System. Full project can be found here
content: One of three components, this project is the server code behind the Multi Module Security System. Using a mix of web sockets and REST API through Node.js, user, message, and module management and verification would be handled here.
Technologies: JavaScript, Node.js (with Express module), Java (for Java-based clients)

name: MMSS Web Client
shortDesc: User-side component for the Multi Module Security System. Full project can be found here
content: One of three components, this project is the front-end that the user would interact with. Using a mix of web sockets and REST API through HTML and Node.js, user and module management can be handled by the user here.
Technologies: JavaScript, Node.js (with Express module), HTML, CSS

name: Intro to Promises (Node.js Demo)
shortDesc: The repo here contains some example code used in a code demo on the use of promises in JavaScript
content: Originally done for a final presentation, the code here demonstrates a simple use case of Promises, which is to load multiple files and wait until the loading process is finished before continuing.
Technologies: JavaScript, Node.js (for demo)

name: Three.js Point Cloud Project
shortDesc: Small project used to help learn Three.js and d3.js
content: During my time as a Research Experience Undergraduate at UIC in the Summer of 2017, I learned how to use Three.js and D3.js. This project was used to help me learn and test my knowledge of the two JS libraries.
Technologies: HTML, Bootstrap, JavaScript, CSS, Three.js, d3.js
footer: Link to web page | Link to GitHub Repository

name: VAST Challenge 2017 - Mini Challenge 2 Entry
shortDesc: My submission to the VAST Challenge 2017 contest. Thanks to Joseph Borowicz for working with me on this
content: During my time as a Research Experience Undergraduate at UIC in the Summer of 2017, some fellow students and I worked on submissions to the VAST Challenge. This repo contains mine and Joseph Borowicz's entry for Mini-Challenge 2 of the contest.
The visualization tool features small multiples, a map that shows simulated streamlines, and a slider to allow the user to traverse through the data.
Technologies: HTML, Bootstrap, JavaScript, CSS, d3.js, jQuery
footer: Link to web page | Link to GitHub Repository

name: Bubbles TacTile Demo
shortDesc: Small game built for large touch screen displays.
content: I created this game during my free time as a Research Experience Undergraduate at UIC in the Summer of 2017. The game utilizes a full-screen SVG for the vast majority of the gameplay, along with d3.js and jQuery for the UI.
Technologies: HTML, Bootstrap, JavaScript, CSS, d3.js, jQuery
footer: Link to web page | Link to GitHub Repository
